answers.answer: There is polyglandular autoimmune disease which is an autoimmune process whereby many endocrine glands can have problems, there is type 1 which consists of hypoparathyroidism, addison's disease and yeast infections, then there is type 2 which is diabetes, thyroid and adddison's disease.Then there is mulitple endocrine neoplasia (men) which is a familial concern for many endocrine cancers, men 1 is usually hyperparathyroidism, pancreatic problems and pituitary problems amongst othersMen 2 a and 2b are more concerning as they also involve medullary carcinoma of the thyroid and pheochromocytomas(adrenaline producing tumors of the adrenal gland) and need even more aggressive attention.I hope this helpsI think what you are describing tells me that this is more of a polyglandular problem with many endocrine glands not working wellHope this does not confuse you more!
